Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 52 runs before retiring hurt due to a shoulder injury.
Hardik Pandya took 3 wickets for 27 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Match for his economical bowling, taking 2 wickets at an economy of 2 from his three overs.
Rishabh Pant finished the match with an unbeaten 36 runs from 26 balls, including a reverse scoop over the keeper for six to win the match.
India won by 8 wickets with 7.4 overs to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed concern about his shoulder injury but emphasized the importance of the win and the need to prepare for the next match against Pakistan.
Paul Stirling, Ireland's captain, acknowledged the difficulty of the match and the pressure applied by India's bowlers.
Jasprit Bumrah highlighted the importance of adapting to the conditions and the proactive approach needed in T20 cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium, New York.
The pitch conditions were a focal point, with both teams needing to adapt to the new ground.
India's net run rate will benefit from the 8-wicket win with 7.4 overs to spare.
